info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 6:01PM CDT until July 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR WHEELER...EASTERN GRAY AND NORTHWESTERN COLLINGSWORTH COUNTIES... At 600 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles west of New Mobeetie to 5 miles east of Mclean, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Shamrock, Briscoe, Wheeler, Mclean, New Mobeetie, Twitty, Lela, Kellerville and Mobeetie. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
